18.str2: From en and a presumed derivative of the base of basis; equivalent to embaino; to intrude on.

18.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

18.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
18.str2: From phusis in the primary sense of blowing; to inflate, i.e. make proud.
Without a cause, purpose; purposelessly, in vain, for nothing. Probably from eiko; idly, i.e. Without reason.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
Probably from the base of ginosko; the intellect, i.e. Mind; by implication, meaning.

19.str2: And, even, also, namely.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
19.str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

19.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
19.str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
19.str2: From epi and choregeo; to furnish besides, i.e. Fully supply, aid or contribute.
And, even, also, namely.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
19.str2: From sun and bibazo (by reduplication) of the base of basis); to drive together, i.e. Unite, to infer, show, teach.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A band, fastening (hence, possibly: a ligament), joint. From haptomai; probably a ligament.
And, even, also, namely.
That which binds together; a band, bond. From sun and desmon; a joint tie, i.e. Ligament, uniting principle, control.

19.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
19.str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Increasing, increase, growth. From auzano; growth.

20.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of stoicheo; something orderly in arrangement, i.e. a serial constituent, proposition.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).

20.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
20.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: From dogma; to prescribe by statute, i.e. to submit to, ceremonially rule.

21.str2: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Singular
21.str2: Prop: I fasten to; I lay hold of, touch, know carnally. Reflexive of hapto; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. To touch.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Singular
21.str2: (a) I taste, (b) I experience. A primary verb; to taste; by implication, to eat; figuratively, to experience.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
21.str2: A prolonged form of an obsolete primary thigo; to manipulate, i.e. Have to do with; by implication, to injure.

22.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Corruption, destruction, decay, rottenness, decomposition. From phtheiro; decay, i.e. Ruin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Using up, abuse, misuse. From a compound of apo and chraomai; the act of using up, i.e. Consumption.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
An injunction, ordinance, precept. From entellomai; an injunction, i.e. Religious precept.

23.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Plural

23.str2: A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
23.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Arbitrary worship, self-imposed worship. From ethelo and threskeia; voluntary piety, i.e. Sanctimony.
Humility, lowliness of mind, modesty. From a compound of tapeinos and the base of phren; humiliation of mind, i.e. Modesty.
Severity, severe treatment. From a compound of a and pheidomai; unsparingness, i.e. Austerity.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

23.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Satisfaction, indulgence. From a presumed derivative of pletho; a filling up, i.e. gratification.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
